page.title: 02Landscape, Swainby & Potto
page.content: The area undulates from 70 to 100 metres above sea level over glacier moraine. Good arable farmland is interspaced with pasture and wooded areas, divided by hedges. The steep {Cleveland escarpment}lies immediately to the south, the{Tees plain}to the north. Swainby Beck gives natural drainage into the Leven. The remaining area is artificially drained into the Wiske. Swainby Church steeple is the most distinctive man-made feature, dominating the scene. Old houses lie beside a pretty stream with well kept banksides and railings. Two stone bridges and a wooden footbridge add character. Modern houses are hidden behind the traditional facade of terraced housing. Ten young trees were planted in 1983 to replace lost elms, and more in the churchyard. At Potto, private garders are a feature.
